entry.title: earliest-known Phoenician inscriptions (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the earliest-known Phoenician inscriptions (examples pictured) were found near Bethlehem?

entry.title: Academy of Music (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that women's rights activist Susan B. Anthony spoke twice at the now defunct Academy of Music in Sioux City, Iowa, during the 1870s?

entry.title: Alexander Armstrong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that upon his rescue, Alexander Armstrong retrieved his journal against his captain's orders, and its publication contradicted the captain's claims about their chances of survival?

entry.title: You're No Good (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jesse Fuller's first release of his song "You're No Good" was more than a year after Bob Dylan had included it on his debut album?

entry.title: Collingham Gardens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when reggae musician Bob Marley was arrested in London for cannabis possession, he falsely told the police he lived in Collingham Gardens?

entry.title: Thomas Yarborough (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1948, Thomas Yarborough became the first African American to be elected as a city council member in California?

entry.title: U.S. sanctions against Iran have adversely impacted (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that U.S. sanctions against Iran have adversely impacted Iranian children with epidermolysis bullosa, among other patients?

entry.title: Lillian Chase (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lillian Chase became interested in diabetes after meeting the first patient to receive insulin, and went on to become an expert in the disease?
